title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
The response accurately includes the first criterion below, but not the second.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in the equilibrium real interest rate identified in part (c).
descriptions: The response does not state that there will be financial capital outflows.
The response states that there will be financial capital outflows.

title: Part (e)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in financial capital flows identified in part (d).

The response must both state that the dollar will depreciate and explain why in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the dollar will depreciate and/or does not explain that financial capital will flow out of the United States seeking higher returns on financial investments in foreign countries, which will result in a decrease in the demand for the dollar or an increase in the supply of the dollar.

The response states that the dollar will depreciate and explains that financial capital will flow out of the United States seeking higher returns on financial investments in foreign countries, which will result in a decrease in the demand for the dollar or an increase in the supply of the dollar.

title: Part (f)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response should be consistent with the change in the international value of the dollar identified in part (e).

The response must both state that the Federal Reserve will sell yen and explain why in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the Federal Reserve will sell yen in the foreign exchange market and/or explain that selling yen in the foreign exchange market will increase the supply of the yen and increase the demand for the dollar, which causes an appreciation of the dollar against the yen.

The response states that the Federal Reserve will sell yen in the foreign exchange market and explains that selling yen in the foreign exchange market will increase the supply of the yen and increase the demand for the dollar, which causes an appreciation of the dollar against the yen.
